017package org.apache.commons.text.translate;
018
019import java.util.Collections;
020import java.util.HashMap;
021import java.util.Map;
022import java.util.Map.Entry;
023import java.util.stream.Collectors;
024
025/**
026 * Class holding various entity data for HTML and XML - generally for use with
027 * the LookupTranslator.
028 * All Maps are generated using {@code java.util.Collections.unmodifiableMap()}.
029 *
030 * @since 1.0
031 */
032public class EntityArrays {
033
034   /**
035     * A Map&lt;CharSequence, CharSequence&gt; to escape
036     * <a href="https://secure.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/wiki/ISO/IEC_8859-1">ISO-8859-1</a>
037     * characters to their named HTML 3.x equivalents.
038     */
039    public static final Map<CharSequence, CharSequence> ISO8859_1_ESCAPE;
040    static {
041        final Map<CharSequence, CharSequence> initialMap = new HashMap<>();
042        initialMap.put("\u00A0", "&nbsp;"); // non-breaking space
043        initialMap.put("\u00A1", "&iexcl;"); // inverted exclamation mark
044        initialMap.put("\u00A2", "&cent;"); // cent sign
045        initialMap.put("\u00A3", "&pound;"); // pound sign
046        initialMap.put("\u00A4", "&curren;"); // currency sign
047        initialMap.put("\u00A5", "&yen;"); // yen sign = yuan sign
048        initialMap.put("\u00A6", "&brvbar;"); // broken bar = broken vertical bar
049        initialMap.put("\u00A7", "&sect;"); // section sign
050        initialMap.put("\u00A8", "&uml;"); // dieresis = spacing dieresis
051        initialMap.put("\u00A9", "&copy;"); // ¬© - copyright sign
052        initialMap.put("\u00AA", "&ordf;"); // feminine ordinal indicator
053        initialMap.put("\u00AB", "&laquo;"); // left-pointing double angle quotation mark = left pointing guillemet
054        initialMap.put("\u00AC", "&not;"); // not sign
055        initialMap.put("\u00AD", "&shy;"); // soft hyphen = discretionary hyphen
056        initialMap.put("\u00AE", "&reg;"); // ¬Æ - registered trademark sign
057        initialMap.put("\u00AF", "&macr;"); // macron = spacing macron = overline = APL overbar
058        initialMap.put("\u00B0", "&deg;"); // degree sign
059        initialMap.put("\u00B1", "&plusmn;"); // plus-minus sign = plus-or-minus sign
060        initialMap.put("\u00B2", "&sup2;"); // superscript two = superscript digit two = squared
061        initialMap.put("\u00B3", "&sup3;"); // superscript three = superscript digit three = cubed
062        initialMap.put("\u00B4", "&acute;"); // acute accent = spacing acute
063        initialMap.put("\u00B5", "&micro;"); // micro sign
064        initialMap.put("\u00B6", "&para;"); // pilcrow sign = paragraph sign
065        initialMap.put("\u00B7", "&middot;"); // middle dot = Georgian comma = Greek middle dot
066        initialMap.put("\u00B8", "&cedil;"); // cedilla = spacing cedilla
067        initialMap.put("\u00B9", "&sup1;"); // superscript one = superscript digit one
068        initialMap.put("\u00BA", "&ordm;"); // masculine ordinal indicator
069        initialMap.put("\u00BB", "&raquo;"); // right-pointing double angle quotation mark = right pointing guillemet
070        initialMap.put("\u00BC", "&frac14;"); // vulgar fraction one quarter = fraction one quarter
071        initialMap.put("\u00BD", "&frac12;"); // vulgar fraction one half = fraction one half
072        initialMap.put("\u00BE", "&frac34;"); // vulgar fraction three quarters = fraction three quarters
073        initialMap.put("\u00BF", "&iquest;"); // inverted question mark = turned question mark
074        initialMap.put("\u00C0", "&Agrave;"); // √Ä - uppercase A, grave accent
075        initialMap.put("\u00C1", "&Aacute;"); // √Å - uppercase A, acute accent
076        initialMap.put("\u00C2", "&Acirc;"); // √Ç - uppercase A, circumflex accent
077        initialMap.put("\u00C3", "&Atilde;"); // √É - uppercase A, tilde
078        initialMap.put("\u00C4", "&Auml;"); // √Ñ - uppercase A, umlaut
079        initialMap.put("\u00C5", "&Aring;"); // √ - uppercase A, ring
080        initialMap.put("\u00C6", "&AElig;"); // √Ü - uppercase AE
081        initialMap.put("\u00C7", "&Ccedil;"); // √á - uppercase C, cedilla
082        initialMap.put("\u00C8", "&Egrave;"); // √à - uppercase E, grave accent
083        initialMap.put("\u00C9", "&Eacute;"); // √â - uppercase E, acute accent
084        initialMap.put("\u00CA", "&Ecirc;"); // √ä - uppercase E, circumflex accent
085        initialMap.put("\u00CB", "&Euml;"); // √ã - uppercase E, umlaut
086        initialMap.put("\u00CC", "&Igrave;"); // √å - uppercase I, grave accent
087        initialMap.put("\u00CD", "&Iacute;"); // √ç - uppercase I, acute accent
088        initialMap.put("\u00CE", "&Icirc;"); // √é - uppercase I, circumflex accent
089        initialMap.put("\u00CF", "&Iuml;"); // √è - uppercase I, umlaut
090        initialMap.put("\u00D0", "&ETH;"); // √ê - uppercase Eth, Icelandic
091        initialMap.put("\u00D1", "&Ntilde;"); // √ë - uppercase N, tilde
092        initialMap.put("\u00D2", "&Ograve;"); // √í - uppercase O, grave accent
093        initialMap.put("\u00D3", "&Oacute;"); // √ì - uppercase O, acute accent
094        initialMap.put("\u00D4", "&Ocirc;"); // √î - uppercase O, circumflex accent
095        initialMap.put("\u00D5", "&Otilde;"); // √ï - uppercase O, tilde
096        initialMap.put("\u00D6", "&Ouml;"); // √ñ - uppercase O, umlaut
097        initialMap.put("\u00D7", "&times;"); // multiplication sign
098        initialMap.put("\u00D8", "&Oslash;"); // √ò - uppercase O, slash
099        initialMap.put("\u00D9", "&Ugrave;"); // √ô - uppercase U, grave accent
100        initialMap.put("\u00DA", "&Uacute;"); // √ö - uppercase U, acute accent
101        initialMap.put("\u00DB", "&Ucirc;"); // √õ - uppercase U, circumflex accent
102        initialMap.put("\u00DC", "&Uuml;"); // √ú - uppercase U, umlaut
103        initialMap.put("\u00DD", "&Yacute;"); // √ù - uppercase Y, acute accent
104        initialMap.put("\u00DE", "&THORN;"); // √û - uppercase THORN, Icelandic
105        initialMap.put("\u00DF", "&szlig;"); // √ü - lowercase sharps, German
106        initialMap.put("\u00E0", "&agrave;"); // √† - lowercase a, grave accent
107        initialMap.put("\u00E1", "&aacute;"); // √° - lowercase a, acute accent
108        initialMap.put("\u00E2", "&acirc;"); // √¢ - lowercase a, circumflex accent
109        initialMap.put("\u00E3", "&atilde;"); // √£ - lowercase a, tilde
110        initialMap.put("\u00E4", "&auml;"); // √§ - lowercase a, umlaut
111        initialMap.put("\u00E5", "&aring;"); // √• - lowercase a, ring
112        initialMap.put("\u00E6", "&aelig;"); // √¶ - lowercase ae
113        initialMap.put("\u00E7", "&ccedil;"); // √ß - lowercase c, cedilla
114        initialMap.put("\u00E8", "&egrave;"); // √® - lowercase e, grave accent
115        initialMap.put("\u00E9", "&eacute;"); // √© - lowercase e, acute accent
116        initialMap.put("\u00EA", "&ecirc;"); // √™ - lowercase e, circumflex accent
117        initialMap.put("\u00EB", "&euml;"); // √´ - lowercase e, umlaut
118        initialMap.put("\u00EC", "&igrave;"); // √¨ - lowercase i, grave accent
119        initialMap.put("\u00ED", "&iacute;"); // √≠ - lowercase i, acute accent
120        initialMap.put("\u00EE", "&icirc;"); // √Æ - lowercase i, circumflex accent
121        initialMap.put("\u00EF", "&iuml;"); // √Ø - lowercase i, umlaut
122        initialMap.put("\u00F0", "&eth;"); // √∞ - lowercase eth, Icelandic
123        initialMap.put("\u00F1", "&ntilde;"); // √± - lowercase n, tilde
124        initialMap.put("\u00F2", "&ograve;"); // √≤ - lowercase o, grave accent
125        initialMap.put("\u00F3", "&oacute;"); // √≥ - lowercase o, acute accent
126        initialMap.put("\u00F4", "&ocirc;"); // √¥ - lowercase o, circumflex accent
127        initialMap.put("\u00F5", "&otilde;"); // √µ - lowercase o, tilde
128        initialMap.put("\u00F6", "&ouml;"); // √∂ - lowercase o, umlaut
129        initialMap.put("\u00F7", "&divide;"); // division sign
130        initialMap.put("\u00F8", "&oslash;"); // √∏ - lowercase o, slash
131        initialMap.put("\u00F9", "&ugrave;"); // √π - lowercase u, grave accent
132        initialMap.put("\u00FA", "&uacute;"); // √∫ - lowercase u, acute accent
133        initialMap.put("\u00FB", "&ucirc;"); // √ª - lowercase u, circumflex accent
134        initialMap.put("\u00FC", "&uuml;"); // √º - lowercase u, umlaut
135        initialMap.put("\u00FD", "&yacute;"); // √Ω - lowercase y, acute accent
136        initialMap.put("\u00FE", "&thorn;"); // √æ - lowercase thorn, Icelandic
137        initialMap.put("\u00FF", "&yuml;"); // √ø - lowercase y, umlaut
138        ISO8859_1_ESCAPE = Collections.unmodifiableMap(initialMap);
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Reverse of {@link #ISO8859_1_ESCAPE} for unescaping purposes.
143     */
144    public static final Map<CharSequence, CharSequence> ISO8859_1_UNESCAPE;
145
146    static {
147        ISO8859_1_UNESCAPE = Collections.unmodifiableMap(invert(ISO8859_1_ESCAPE));
148    }
149
150    /**
151     * A Map&lt;CharSequence, CharSequence&gt; to escape additional
152     * <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/sgml/entities.html">character entity
153     * references</a>. Note that this must be used with {@link #ISO8859_1_ESCAPE} to get the full list of
154     * HTML 4.0 character entities.
155     */
156    public static final Map<CharSequence, CharSequence> HTML40_EXTENDED_ESCAPE;
157
158    static {
159        final Map<CharSequence, CharSequence> initialMap = new HashMap<>();
160        // <!-- Latin Extended-B -->
161        initialMap.put("\u0192", "&fnof;"); // latin small f with hook = function= florin, U+0192 ISOtech -->
162        // <!-- Greek -->
163        initialMap.put("\u0391", "&Alpha;"); // greek capital letter alpha, U+0391 -->
164        initialMap.put("\u0392", "&Beta;"); // greek capital letter beta, U+0392 -->
165        initialMap.put("\u0393", "&Gamma;"); // greek capital letter gamma,U+0393 ISOgrk3 -->
166        initialMap.put("\u0394", "&Delta;"); // greek capital letter delta,U+0394 ISOgrk3 -->
167        initialMap.put("\u0395", "&Epsilon;"); // greek capital letter epsilon, U+0395 -->
168        initialMap.put("\u0396", "&Zeta;"); // greek capital letter zeta, U+0396 -->
169        initialMap.put("\u0397", "&Eta;"); // greek capital letter eta, U+0397 -->
170        initialMap.put("\u0398", "&Theta;"); // greek capital letter theta,U+0398 ISOgrk3 -->
171        initialMap.put("\u0399", "&Iota;"); // greek capital letter iota, U+0399 -->
172        initialMap.put("\u039A", "&Kappa;"); // greek capital letter kappa, U+039A -->
173        initialMap.put("\u039B", "&Lambda;"); // greek capital letter lambda,U+039B ISOgrk3 -->
174        initialMap.put("\u039C", "&Mu;"); // greek capital letter mu, U+039C -->
175        initialMap.put("\u039D", "&Nu;"); // greek capital letter nu, U+039D -->
176        initialMap.put("\u039E", "&Xi;"); // greek capital letter xi, U+039E ISOgrk3 -->
177        initialMap.put("\u039F", "&Omicron;"); // greek capital letter omicron, U+039F -->
178        initialMap.put("\u03A0", "&Pi;"); // greek capital letter pi, U+03A0 ISOgrk3 -->
179        initialMap.put("\u03A1", "&Rho;"); // greek capital letter rho, U+03A1 -->
180        // <!-- there is no Sigmaf, and no U+03A2 character either -->
181        initialMap.put("\u03A3", "&Sigma;"); // greek capital letter sigma,U+03A3 ISOgrk3 -->
182        initialMap.put("\u03A4", "&Tau;"); // greek capital letter tau, U+03A4 -->
183        initialMap.put("\u03A5", "&Upsilon;"); // greek capital letter upsilon,U+03A5 ISOgrk3 -->
184        initialMap.put("\u03A6", "&Phi;"); // greek capital letter phi,U+03A6 ISOgrk3 -->
185        initialMap.put("\u03A7", "&Chi;"); // greek capital letter chi, U+03A7 -->
186        initialMap.put("\u03A8", "&Psi;"); // greek capital letter psi,U+03A8 ISOgrk3 -->
187        initialMap.put("\u03A9", "&Omega;"); // greek capital letter omega,U+03A9 ISOgrk3 -->
188        initialMap.put("\u03B1", "&alpha;"); // greek small letter alpha,U+03B1 ISOgrk3 -->
189        initialMap.put("\u03B2", "&beta;"); // greek small letter beta, U+03B2 ISOgrk3 -->
190        initialMap.put("\u03B3", "&gamma;"); // greek small letter gamma,U+03B3 ISOgrk3 -->
191        initialMap.put("\u03B4", "&delta;"); // greek small letter delta,U+03B4 ISOgrk3 -->
192        initialMap.put("\u03B5", "&epsilon;"); // greek small letter epsilon,U+03B5 ISOgrk3 -->
193        initialMap.put("\u03B6", "&zeta;"); // greek small letter zeta, U+03B6 ISOgrk3 -->
194        initialMap.put("\u03B7", "&eta;"); // greek small letter eta, U+03B7 ISOgrk3 -->
195        initialMap.put("\u03B8", "&theta;"); // greek small letter theta,U+03B8 ISOgrk3 -->
196        initialMap.put("\u03B9", "&iota;"); // greek small letter iota, U+03B9 ISOgrk3 -->
197        initialMap.put("\u03BA", "&kappa;"); // greek small letter kappa,U+03BA ISOgrk3 -->
198        initialMap.put("\u03BB", "&lambda;"); // greek small letter lambda,U+03BB ISOgrk3 -->
199        initialMap.put("\u03BC", "&mu;"); // greek small letter mu, U+03BC ISOgrk3 -->
200        initialMap.put("\u03BD", "&nu;"); // greek small letter nu, U+03BD ISOgrk3 -->
201        initialMap.put("\u03BE", "&xi;"); // greek small letter xi, U+03BE ISOgrk3 -->
202        initialMap.put("\u03BF", "&omicron;"); // greek small letter omicron, U+03BF NEW -->
203        initialMap.put("\u03C0", "&pi;"); // greek small letter pi, U+03C0 ISOgrk3 -->
204        initialMap.put("\u03C1", "&rho;"); // greek small letter rho, U+03C1 ISOgrk3 -->
205        initialMap.put("\u03C2", "&sigmaf;"); // greek small letter final sigma,U+03C2 ISOgrk3 -->
206        initialMap.put("\u03C3", "&sigma;"); // greek small letter sigma,U+03C3 ISOgrk3 -->
207        initialMap.put("\u03C4", "&tau;"); // greek small letter tau, U+03C4 ISOgrk3 -->
208        initialMap.put("\u03C5", "&upsilon;"); // greek small letter upsilon,U+03C5 ISOgrk3 -->
209        initialMap.put("\u03C6", "&phi;"); // greek small letter phi, U+03C6 ISOgrk3 -->
210        initialMap.put("\u03C7", "&chi;"); // greek small letter chi, U+03C7 ISOgrk3 -->
211        initialMap.put("\u03C8", "&psi;"); // greek small letter psi, U+03C8 ISOgrk3 -->
212        initialMap.put("\u03C9", "&omega;"); // greek small letter omega,U+03C9 ISOgrk3 -->
213        initialMap.put("\u03D1", "&thetasym;"); // greek small letter theta symbol,U+03D1 NEW -->
214        initialMap.put("\u03D2", "&upsih;"); // greek upsilon with hook symbol,U+03D2 NEW -->
215        initialMap.put("\u03D6", "&piv;"); // greek pi symbol, U+03D6 ISOgrk3 -->
216        // <!-- General Punctuation -->
217        initialMap.put("\u2022", "&bull;"); // bullet = black small circle,U+2022 ISOpub -->
218        // <!-- bullet is NOT the same as bullet operator, U+2219 -->
219        initialMap.put("\u2026", "&hellip;"); // horizontal ellipsis = three dot leader,U+2026 ISOpub -->
220        initialMap.put("\u2032", "&prime;"); // prime = minutes = feet, U+2032 ISOtech -->
221        initialMap.put("\u2033", "&Prime;"); // double prime = seconds = inches,U+2033 ISOtech -->
222        initialMap.put("\u203E", "&oline;"); // overline = spacing overscore,U+203E NEW -->
223        initialMap.put("\u2044", "&frasl;"); // fraction slash, U+2044 NEW -->
224        // <!-- Letterlike Symbols -->
225        initialMap.put("\u2118", "&weierp;"); // script capital P = power set= Weierstrass p, U+2118 ISOamso -->
226        initialMap.put("\u2111", "&image;"); // blackletter capital I = imaginary part,U+2111 ISOamso -->
227        initialMap.put("\u211C", "&real;"); // blackletter capital R = real part symbol,U+211C ISOamso -->
228        initialMap.put("\u2122", "&trade;"); // trade mark sign, U+2122 ISOnum -->
229        initialMap.put("\u2135", "&alefsym;"); // alef symbol = first transfinite cardinal,U+2135 NEW -->
230        // <!-- alef symbol is NOT the same as hebrew letter alef,U+05D0 although the
231        // same glyph could be used to depict both characters -->
232        // <!-- Arrows -->
233        initialMap.put("\u2190", "&larr;"); // leftwards arrow, U+2190 ISOnum -->
234        initialMap.put("\u2191", "&uarr;"); // upwards arrow, U+2191 ISOnum-->
235        initialMap.put("\u2192", "&rarr;"); // rightwards arrow, U+2192 ISOnum -->
236        initialMap.put("\u2193", "&darr;"); // downwards arrow, U+2193 ISOnum -->
237        initialMap.put("\u2194", "&harr;"); // left right arrow, U+2194 ISOamsa -->
238        initialMap.put("\u21B5", "&crarr;"); // downwards arrow with corner leftwards= carriage return, U+21B5 NEW -->
239        initialMap.put("\u21D0", "&lArr;"); // leftwards double arrow, U+21D0 ISOtech -->
240        // <!-- ISO 10646 does not say that lArr is the same as the 'is implied by'
241        // arrow but also does not have any other character for that function.
242        // So ? lArr canbe used for 'is implied by' as ISOtech suggests -->
243        initialMap.put("\u21D1", "&uArr;"); // upwards double arrow, U+21D1 ISOamsa -->
244        initialMap.put("\u21D2", "&rArr;"); // rightwards double arrow,U+21D2 ISOtech -->
245        // <!-- ISO 10646 does not say this is the 'implies' character but does not
246        // have another character with this function so ?rArr can be used for
247        // 'implies' as ISOtech suggests -->
248        initialMap.put("\u21D3", "&dArr;"); // downwards double arrow, U+21D3 ISOamsa -->
249        initialMap.put("\u21D4", "&hArr;"); // left right double arrow,U+21D4 ISOamsa -->
250        // <!-- Mathematical Operators -->
251        initialMap.put("\u2200", "&forall;"); // for all, U+2200 ISOtech -->
252        initialMap.put("\u2202", "&part;"); // partial differential, U+2202 ISOtech -->
253        initialMap.put("\u2203", "&exist;"); // there exists, U+2203 ISOtech -->
254        initialMap.put("\u2205", "&empty;"); // empty set = null set = diameter,U+2205 ISOamso -->
255        initialMap.put("\u2207", "&nabla;"); // nabla = backward difference,U+2207 ISOtech -->
256        initialMap.put("\u2208", "&isin;"); // element of, U+2208 ISOtech -->
257        initialMap.put("\u2209", "&notin;"); // not an element of, U+2209 ISOtech -->
258        initialMap.put("\u220B", "&ni;"); // contains as member, U+220B ISOtech -->
259        // <!-- should there be a more memorable name than 'ni'? -->
260        initialMap.put("\u220F", "&prod;"); // n-ary product = product sign,U+220F ISOamsb -->
261        // <!-- prod is NOT the same character as U+03A0 'greek capital letter pi'
262        // though the same glyph might be used for both -->
263        initialMap.put("\u2211", "&sum;"); // n-ary summation, U+2211 ISOamsb -->
264        // <!-- sum is NOT the same character as U+03A3 'greek capital letter sigma'
265        // though the same glyph might be used for both -->
266        initialMap.put("\u2212", "&minus;"); // minus sign, U+2212 ISOtech -->
267        initialMap.put("\u2217", "&lowast;"); // asterisk operator, U+2217 ISOtech -->
268        initialMap.put("\u221A", "&radic;"); // square root = radical sign,U+221A ISOtech -->
269        initialMap.put("\u221D", "&prop;"); // proportional to, U+221D ISOtech -->
270        initialMap.put("\u221E", "&infin;"); // infinity, U+221E ISOtech -->
271        initialMap.put("\u2220", "&ang;"); // angle, U+2220 ISOamso -->
272        initialMap.put("\u2227", "&and;"); // logical and = wedge, U+2227 ISOtech -->
273        initialMap.put("\u2228", "&or;"); // logical or = vee, U+2228 ISOtech -->
274        initialMap.put("\u2229", "&cap;"); // intersection = cap, U+2229 ISOtech -->
275        initialMap.put("\u222A", "&cup;"); // union = cup, U+222A ISOtech -->
276        initialMap.put("\u222B", "&int;"); // integral, U+222B ISOtech -->
277        initialMap.put("\u2234", "&there4;"); // therefore, U+2234 ISOtech -->
278        initialMap.put("\u223C", "&sim;"); // tilde operator = varies with = similar to,U+223C ISOtech -->
279        // <!-- tilde operator is NOT the same character as the tilde, U+007E,although
280        // the same glyph might be used to represent both -->
281        initialMap.put("\u2245", "&cong;"); // approximately equal to, U+2245 ISOtech -->
282        initialMap.put("\u2248", "&asymp;"); // almost equal to = asymptotic to,U+2248 ISOamsr -->
283        initialMap.put("\u2260", "&ne;"); // not equal to, U+2260 ISOtech -->
284        initialMap.put("\u2261", "&equiv;"); // identical to, U+2261 ISOtech -->
285        initialMap.put("\u2264", "&le;"); // less-than or equal to, U+2264 ISOtech -->
286        initialMap.put("\u2265", "&ge;"); // greater-than or equal to,U+2265 ISOtech -->
287        initialMap.put("\u2282", "&sub;"); // subset of, U+2282 ISOtech -->
288        initialMap.put("\u2283", "&sup;"); // superset of, U+2283 ISOtech -->
289        // <!-- note that nsup, 'not a superset of, U+2283' is not covered by the
290        // Symbol font encoding and is not included. Should it be, for symmetry?
291        // It is in ISOamsn -->,
292        initialMap.put("\u2284", "&nsub;"); // not a subset of, U+2284 ISOamsn -->
293        initialMap.put("\u2286", "&sube;"); // subset of or equal to, U+2286 ISOtech -->
294        initialMap.put("\u2287", "&supe;"); // superset of or equal to,U+2287 ISOtech -->
295        initialMap.put("\u2295", "&oplus;"); // circled plus = direct sum,U+2295 ISOamsb -->
296        initialMap.put("\u2297", "&otimes;"); // circled times = vector product,U+2297 ISOamsb -->
297        initialMap.put("\u22A5", "&perp;"); // up tack = orthogonal to = perpendicular,U+22A5 ISOtech -->
298        initialMap.put("\u22C5", "&sdot;"); // dot operator, U+22C5 ISOamsb -->
299        // <!-- dot operator is NOT the same character as U+00B7 middle dot -->
300        // <!-- Miscellaneous Technical -->
301        initialMap.put("\u2308", "&lceil;"); // left ceiling = apl upstile,U+2308 ISOamsc -->
302        initialMap.put("\u2309", "&rceil;"); // right ceiling, U+2309 ISOamsc -->
303        initialMap.put("\u230A", "&lfloor;"); // left floor = apl downstile,U+230A ISOamsc -->
304        initialMap.put("\u230B", "&rfloor;"); // right floor, U+230B ISOamsc -->
305        initialMap.put("\u2329", "&lang;"); // left-pointing angle bracket = bra,U+2329 ISOtech -->
306        // <!-- lang is NOT the same character as U+003C 'less than' or U+2039 'single left-pointing angle quotation
307        // mark' -->
308        initialMap.put("\u232A", "&rang;"); // right-pointing angle bracket = ket,U+232A ISOtech -->
309        // <!-- rang is NOT the same character as U+003E 'greater than' or U+203A
310        // 'single right-pointing angle quotation mark' -->
311        // <!-- Geometric Shapes -->
312        initialMap.put("\u25CA", "&loz;"); // lozenge, U+25CA ISOpub -->
313        // <!-- Miscellaneous Symbols -->
314        initialMap.put("\u2660", "&spades;"); // black spade suit, U+2660 ISOpub -->
315        // <!-- black here seems to mean filled as opposed to hollow -->
316        initialMap.put("\u2663", "&clubs;"); // black club suit = shamrock,U+2663 ISOpub -->
317        initialMap.put("\u2665", "&hearts;"); // black heart suit = valentine,U+2665 ISOpub -->
318        initialMap.put("\u2666", "&diams;"); // black diamond suit, U+2666 ISOpub -->
319
320        // <!-- Latin Extended-A -->
321        initialMap.put("\u0152", "&OElig;"); // -- latin capital ligature OE,U+0152 ISOlat2 -->
322        initialMap.put("\u0153", "&oelig;"); // -- latin small ligature oe, U+0153 ISOlat2 -->
323        // <!-- ligature is a misnomer, this is a separate character in some languages -->
324        initialMap.put("\u0160", "&Scaron;"); // -- latin capital letter S with caron,U+0160 ISOlat2 -->
325        initialMap.put("\u0161", "&scaron;"); // -- latin small letter s with caron,U+0161 ISOlat2 -->
326        initialMap.put("\u0178", "&Yuml;"); // -- latin capital letter Y with dieresis,U+0178 ISOlat2 -->
327        // <!-- Spacing Modifier Letters -->
328        initialMap.put("\u02C6", "&circ;"); // -- modifier letter circumflex accent,U+02C6 ISOpub -->
329        initialMap.put("\u02DC", "&tilde;"); // small tilde, U+02DC ISOdia -->
330        // <!-- General Punctuation -->
331        initialMap.put("\u2002", "&ensp;"); // en space, U+2002 ISOpub -->
332        initialMap.put("\u2003", "&emsp;"); // em space, U+2003 ISOpub -->
333        initialMap.put("\u2009", "&thinsp;"); // thin space, U+2009 ISOpub -->
334        initialMap.put("\u200C", "&zwnj;"); // zero width non-joiner,U+200C NEW RFC 2070 -->
335        initialMap.put("\u200D", "&zwj;"); // zero width joiner, U+200D NEW RFC 2070 -->
336        initialMap.put("\u200E", "&lrm;"); // left-to-right mark, U+200E NEW RFC 2070 -->
337        initialMap.put("\u200F", "&rlm;"); // right-to-left mark, U+200F NEW RFC 2070 -->
338        initialMap.put("\u2013", "&ndash;"); // en dash, U+2013 ISOpub -->
339        initialMap.put("\u2014", "&mdash;"); // em dash, U+2014 ISOpub -->
340        initialMap.put("\u2018", "&lsquo;"); // left single quotation mark,U+2018 ISOnum -->
341        initialMap.put("\u2019", "&rsquo;"); // right single quotation mark,U+2019 ISOnum -->
342        initialMap.put("\u201A", "&sbquo;"); // single low-9 quotation mark, U+201A NEW -->
343        initialMap.put("\u201C", "&ldquo;"); // left double quotation mark,U+201C ISOnum -->
344        initialMap.put("\u201D", "&rdquo;"); // right double quotation mark,U+201D ISOnum -->
345        initialMap.put("\u201E", "&bdquo;"); // double low-9 quotation mark, U+201E NEW -->
346        initialMap.put("\u2020", "&dagger;"); // dagger, U+2020 ISOpub -->
347        initialMap.put("\u2021", "&Dagger;"); // double dagger, U+2021 ISOpub -->
348        initialMap.put("\u2030", "&permil;"); // per mille sign, U+2030 ISOtech -->
349        initialMap.put("\u2039", "&lsaquo;"); // single left-pointing angle quotation mark,U+2039 ISO proposed -->
350        // <!-- lsaquo is proposed but not yet ISO standardized -->
351        initialMap.put("\u203A", "&rsaquo;"); // single right-pointing angle quotation mark,U+203A ISO proposed -->
352        // <!-- rsaquo is proposed but not yet ISO standardized -->
353        initialMap.put("\u20AC", "&euro;"); // -- euro sign, U+20AC NEW -->
354        HTML40_EXTENDED_ESCAPE = Collections.unmodifiableMap(initialMap);
355    }
356
357    /**
358     * Reverse of {@link #HTML40_EXTENDED_ESCAPE} for unescaping purposes.
359     */
360    public static final Map<CharSequence, CharSequence> HTML40_EXTENDED_UNESCAPE;
361
362    static {
363        HTML40_EXTENDED_UNESCAPE = Collections.unmodifiableMap(invert(HTML40_EXTENDED_ESCAPE));
364    }
365
366    /**
367     * A Map&lt;CharSequence, CharSequence&gt; to escape the basic XML and HTML
368     * character entities.
369     *
370     * Namely: {@code " & < >}
371     */
372    public static final Map<CharSequence, CharSequence> BASIC_ESCAPE;
373
374    static {
375        final Map<CharSequence, CharSequence> initialMap = new HashMap<>();
376        initialMap.put("\"", "&quot;"); // " - double-quote
377        initialMap.put("&", "&amp;");   // & - ampersand
378        initialMap.put("<", "&lt;");    // < - less-than
379        initialMap.put(">", "&gt;");    // > - greater-than
380        BASIC_ESCAPE = Collections.unmodifiableMap(initialMap);
381    }
382
383    /**
384     * Reverse of {@link #BASIC_ESCAPE} for unescaping purposes.
385     */
386    public static final Map<CharSequence, CharSequence> BASIC_UNESCAPE;
387
388    static {
389        BASIC_UNESCAPE = Collections.unmodifiableMap(invert(BASIC_ESCAPE));
390    }
391
392    /**
393     * A Map&lt;CharSequence, CharSequence&gt; to escape the apostrophe character to
394     * its XML character entity.
395     */
396    public static final Map<CharSequence, CharSequence> APOS_ESCAPE;
397
398    static {
399        final Map<CharSequence, CharSequence> initialMap = new HashMap<>();
400        initialMap.put("'", "&apos;"); // XML apostrophe
401        APOS_ESCAPE = Collections.unmodifiableMap(initialMap);
402    }
403
404    /**
405     * Reverse of {@link #APOS_ESCAPE} for unescaping purposes.
406     */
407    public static final Map<CharSequence, CharSequence> APOS_UNESCAPE;
408
409    static {
410        APOS_UNESCAPE = Collections.unmodifiableMap(invert(APOS_ESCAPE));
411    }
412
413    /**
414     * A Map&lt;CharSequence, CharSequence&gt; to escape the Java
415     * control characters.
416     *
417     * Namely: {@code \b \n \t \f \r}
418     */
419    public static final Map<CharSequence, CharSequence> JAVA_CTRL_CHARS_ESCAPE;
420
421    static {
422        final Map<CharSequence, CharSequence> initialMap = new HashMap<>();
423        initialMap.put("\b", "\\b");
424        initialMap.put("\n", "\\n");
425        initialMap.put("\t", "\\t");
426        initialMap.put("\f", "\\f");
427        initialMap.put("\r", "\\r");
428        JAVA_CTRL_CHARS_ESCAPE = Collections.unmodifiableMap(initialMap);
429    }
430
431    /**
432     * Reverse of {@link #JAVA_CTRL_CHARS_ESCAPE} for unescaping purposes.
433     */
434    public static final Map<CharSequence, CharSequence> JAVA_CTRL_CHARS_UNESCAPE;
435
436    static {
437        JAVA_CTRL_CHARS_UNESCAPE = Collections.unmodifiableMap(invert(JAVA_CTRL_CHARS_ESCAPE));
438    }
439
440    /**
441     * Inverts an escape Map into an unescape Map.
442     *
443     * @param map Map&lt;String, String&gt; to be inverted
444     * @return Map&lt;String, String&gt; inverted array
445     */
446    public static Map<CharSequence, CharSequence> invert(final Map<CharSequence, CharSequence> map) {
447        return map.entrySet().stream().collect(Collectors.toMap(Entry::getValue, Entry::getKey));
448    }
449
450}
